author: Vaseem Baig

text: It's hard to come up with something that sounds so much like Ennio Morricone's work from The Man With No Name trilogy as this does. Anyone's who's listened to The Good, The Bad and The Ugly soundtrack will hear clear influences from not only his sound, but from the note sequences. I still like it.

text: Equipment didn't really do much in the first place, and instead you have the whole skill equipping system.  And... I generally prefer ACF's music, but honestly both soundtracks are pretty awesome.
author: Garlyle Wilds

text: You may want to consider trying Alter Code F instead.  It's basically an updated remake of the game, using the standards created through WA2 and WA3.  There's a lot of new stuff that helps the game feel even more strategic and in-depth, and it doesn't feel so old anymore, even if there's still no voice acting.
